business.headline: GST buying bonanza kicks off, cars lead the wayPM Narendra Modi described GST 2.0 as "a reform dedicated to the people of India," and for many, the benefits were felt immediately.

Is your income tax refund less than Rs 10,000? Here's why it might reach you fasterMany taxpayers are frustrated with refund delays. But here's the catch, simpler refunds tend to move more quickly through the system than bigger claims.

Festive season stock picks: Which sectors are the best bet right now?Autos have already seen a sharp rally, while consumer durables, FMCG, PSU banks, and infrastructure are also emerging as areas to watch.

Sensex and Nifty end flat as IT losses offset consumer stock gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 11.83 points to 82,102.1, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 32.85 points lower at 25,169.50. The broader small- and mid-cap indices also lagged, declining 0.5% and 0.4%, respectively.

Indian-origin Srinivas Gopalan, Rahul Goyal appointed as CEOs of two big US companiesTwo major US companies have appointed Indian-origin CEOs. Telecom giant T-Mobile announced Srinivasan Gopalan will take over as CEO from November 1. Beverage major Molson Coors has chosen Rahul Goyal as its new CEO, effective October 1. Gopalan's appointment comes as the US wireless market faces challenges, including slowing subscriber growth and fierce competition. Goyal, a company veteran, has previously served in key roles including CFO of Molson Coors India. These appointments are notable amidst discussions around the H1B visa program in the US. A reporter noted, "Desi CEO for US Giants is the biggest news in the day for Telecom and IT space as well." This highlights the significance of these leadership changes in the corporate world.

Gold rises to all-time high. 3 reasons behind its strengthInvestors are flocking to gold as it climbs to record highs, supported by currency weakness, economic uncertainty, and inflationary pressures. Here are the three main drivers.

Denied, delayed, dismissed: Inside India's broken health insurance systemIn this special report, part of our 'CLAIM DENIED' series, we uncover why health insurance in India has become a gamble for families, as rising premiums, delayed settlements, and weak accountability leave them vulnerable when they need support most.

SIP vs SWP: How to turn your retirement corpus into reliable incomeAccumulating wealth through SIPs is just the beginning of retirement planning. The real challenge is turning that corpus into a steady income. Here's how you can do it.

PF pre-retirement withdrawal rules likely to be relaxed: ReportAt present, EPFO members can withdraw their entire corpus only after reaching the retirement age of 58, or if they remain unemployed for more than two months.

Launching a startup? This government scheme simplifies early fundingStarting a startup is exciting but securing funds at the initial stage is often a hurdle. This government scheme provides seed funding through incubators, giving you the financial boost to test, prototype, and launch your product.

ITR-5 and ITR-7 filing opens online. Who can file and by when?The Income Tax Department has opened online filing for ITR-5 and ITR-7 forms for AY 2025–26. These forms are not meant for individuals but for specific entities. Here's a quick look at who needs to file and the deadlines.

Who is Srini Gopalan, T-Mobile's new Indian-origin CEOSrini Gopalan will take over from Mike Sievert, who has been named Vice Chairman. Mike Sievert, the outgoing CEO, said that Gopalan was the natural choice to take T-Mobile forward.

Gold shines at an all-time high, but is it safe to invest?The yellow metal, traditionally seen as a safe haven in uncertain times, has surged sharply in the past year, supported by global factors ranging from geopolitical tensions to central bank buying.

Take that, MAGA. Two big US firms appoint Indian-origin CEOs amid H-1B crackdownAmid H-1B tensions, two Indian-origin executives, Srinivas Gopalan and Rahul Goyal, rise to top US leadership roles, defying Make America Great Again (MAGA) hardliners and reshaping America's corporate landscape.

Markets edge higher, auto stocks lead early gains; volatility loomsThe Sensex climbed nearly 100 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 hovered above 25,200. Broader indices, however, struggled to find traction as pockets of profit booking introduced early volatility.

Ministry of Finance bans spending on Diwali gifts, orders all to complyThe latest notice from the Ministry of Finance comes as part of the government's continuing efforts to enforce fiscal discipline and restrict non-essential spending.

Nvidia to invest $100 billion in OpenAI for next-gen AI infrastructureThe companies unveiled a letter of intent for a landmark strategic partnership to deploy at least 10 gigawatts of Nvidia chips for OpenAI's AI infrastructure.

Why Noida is emerging as India's next hotspot for branded residencesNoida is shedding its image as just a satellite city of Delhi. With luxury developers entering the market, it's fast becoming India's go-to destination for branded residences that promise prestige, comfort, and modern living.

IndusInd Bank's ex-CFO records statement in accounting lapse probeMumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has so far recorded statements of seven to eight employees of the bank. Ex-CFO Gobind Jain recorded his statement today.

Income tax refund claim rejected? CA explains how to rectify and reapplyGetting your income tax refund rejected can be unsettling, especially after filing on time. But in most cases, the issues are minor and fixable. Here's a look at why rejections occur and how to reapply successfully.

Gold, silver or equity: Where should you invest right now?Gold prices touched a fresh record high on the 1st day of Navrartri, once again sparking the age-old debate among investors: where should money be parked during this time, gold, silver, or equity?

Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses GST, MSME benefits, key reformsUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw held a press conference, detailing the benefits of GST reform. The Minister explained how GST advantages extend to all states, estimating a saving of Rs 3,500 for a middle-class family.

Sensex falls over 450 points, Nifty settles lower as IT stocks tumbleThe sell-off was led by information technology stocks, which tumbled nearly 2% after President Donald Trump announced a $100,000 fee for new H-1B visa applications.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why is the stock market falling todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 503.31 points at 82,122.92 by 2:55 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 143.80 points to 25,183.20. Volatility surged across broader market segments, with most indices in the red.

IT sector faces H-1B visa jitters: Should you keep your money parked or sell?Recent changes to the H-1B visa programme have triggered new worries for Indian IT companies, already facing weaker client demand.

Turning 50? Here's how to protect your retirement savings, explains financial advisorHitting 50 can be a mix of pride and worry, especially when it comes to money. Even after years of saving and investing, many fear their retirement funds may not last as long as planned. Here are expert tips to safeguard your savings.

Errors in ITR filing? 3 simple ways to fix it: Revise, rectify or updateWorried about spotting a mistake in your ITR after filing? You're not alone. Errors happen to many taxpayers. Thankfully, the system gives you not one but three ways to fix them. Let's have a look.

Should you still bet on IT stocks as H-1B visa worries resurface?The US move on H-1B visa has stirred fears of rising costs and tighter restrictions on tech firms that rely on sending skilled workers to client locations.

GST 2.0 rate cut: Groceries, electronic items get cheaper this festive seasonThis report examines the impact of GST rate changes on household budgets, focusing on groceries and electronics. Items like chocolates and shampoos are now cheaper, with shampoos moving from an 18% to a 5% tax bracket. In contrast, aerated drinks are subject to a 'sin tax'. The report highlights significant savings, noting, "an average saving of 10% will mean 5000 rupees per month saving" for a consumer with a monthly income of one lakh rupees. The changes are presented as a "festive gift from the Modi government," with major electronics also seeing price drops. Televisions over 32 inches, previously in a 28% slab, are now taxed at 18%, resulting in substantial savings for consumers looking to upgrade. Washing machines, refrigerators, and dishwashers also benefit from a 10% tax reduction.

Live: GST 2.0 kicks off, BJP urges traders to pass on relief to consumersThe GST Council has approved major tax reforms effective today, September 22, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18% to ease compliance and lower costs. Essential items like soaps, shampoos, bicycles, and packaged foods will now attract 5% GST, while appliances such as ACs and large TVs will be taxed at 18%, down from 28%. Luxury and sin goods, including tobacco and high-end cars, will continue to face a 40% levy plus compensation cess. Follow Indiatoday.in for latest updates.

Tech Mahindra, TCS, Infosys: Why are IT stocks falling today?Tech Mahindra was the worst hit, sliding nearly 5% in early trade. Infosys, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), HCLTech and Wipro also fell more than 2.5% each. The Nifty IT index shed almost 3%, making it one of the day's worst-performing sectoral indices.
Sensex down 346 points, Nifty below 25,300; Tech Mahindra tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 267.56 points to 82,358.67, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48.60 points to 25,278.45​​​​​​​ as of 9:25 am.

Kunal Bahl, rejected for H-1B, consoles techies: I did well in India, didn't I?While India has long been the biggest beneficiary of H-1B visas, accounting for 71% of all approvals last year, uncertainty has cast a shadow over careers, education plans and the information technology industry.

GST 2.0 kicks in: What changes in your shopping bill from today Live UpdatesThe government expects GST 2.0 to reduce compliance challenges, cut disputes, and make goods and services cheaper for households. Read on to know which items get cheaper and which turn costlier from today.

GST 2.0 comes into effect: What's cheaper and costlier from todayAs the new rates under GST 2.0 come into effect from Monday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the reforms will boost savings for households, farmers, shopkeepers, and businesses.

ITR refund under processing? Here's how to check status and what to do nextIf your refund remains under processing, first ensure your ITR has been e-verified, as refunds cannot be processed without this step. You can also check Form 26AS to verify if the refund has already been credited to your account.

From grocery runs to gym sessions: What today's homebuyers really wantToday's urban buyers want more than a home, they seek a lifestyle where comfort, convenience, and community come together, and daily needs, work, and wellness coexist effortlessly.

Piyush Goyal to visit US for trade talks on September 22 amid tariff, H-1B tensionsThe minister will visit New York and will be accompanied by special secretary in the ministry Rajesh Agrawal and other officials.

H-1B visa holders cancel trips to India for weddings, Diwali amid new fee hikeWhile many cancelled plans to travel at the last minute while waiting to board flights to India, several others already in India are scrambling to return amid lack of clarity after Trump on Friday signed a proclamation to raise the H-1B visa fees.

Amul cuts prices of 700 products, ghee cheaper by Rs 40 per litre from Sept 22Amul, marketed by the Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation (GCMMF), on Saturday announced a price reduction for over 700 products, including ghee, butter, ice cream, cheese, and frozen snacks. The move comes after a GST rate cut, with the company passing the benefits to consumers.

entertainment.headline: SRK's struggle to wear National Award medal goes viral. Rani-Vikrant come to rescueShah Rukh Khan struggled to wear his medal at the 71st National Film Awards 2025. The cute moment was captured on video and quickly went viral among fans online.

How Pawan Singh's participation in Rise & Fall was a missed opportunityBhojpuri actor Pawan Singh's exit from 'Rise & Fall' was announced by the show's host Ashneer Grover on Sunday. Despite being called 'TRP king' by his fans, his stint on the reality show was far from impressive. Here's why.

This silver is gold: Suhana, Aryan's sweet note for papa SRK's National Award winSuhana Khan and Aryan Khan posted a sweet message for their father Shah Rukh Khan after he received the National Film Award for Best Actor for 'Jawan'.

Actor Suriya's security officer duped of Rs 42 lakh by his domestic help's familyActor Suriya's PSO was cheated of Rs 42 lakh by his domestic help's family. The scam has wider implications as police uncover a Rs 2 crore fraud racket in Chennai.

Real fear is within: Vidhu Vinod Chopra on 12th Fail's National Award winDirector Vidhu Vinod Chopra's film '12th Fail', depicting Manoj Kumar Sharma's inspiring rise from poverty to the IPS, won a National Award in New Delhi. The filmmaker, in an exclusive interview with AajTak, emphasised that his cinema is about truth and inner conviction, hoping audiences engage deeply with his work.

Poonam Pandey removed from Mandodari role in Delhi Ramlila amid objectionsThe Luv Kush Ramlila Committee has removed actor Poonam Pandey from playing Mandodari at Delhi's Red Fort after facing objections from political and religious groups. The committee said the decision was made to ensure the event's core purpose of spreading Lord Ram's message is upheld.

Rani Mukerji wears necklace with daughter Adira's initials at National Awards. PicRani Mukerji won the Best Actress award at the 71st National Film Awards for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway' and added a personal touch to her look with a gold chain featuring her daughter Adira's initials.

Exclusive: Homebound Oscar selection sparks rule debate, FFI chairman responds'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for the Oscars 2026. The decision sparked debate over the film's theatrical release and screening timeline compliance.

Janaawar OTT: When and where to watch Bhuvan Arora's crime seriesBhuvan Arora leads 'Janaawar – The Beast Within', a gritty crime drama about a tribal sub-inspector drawn into a dangerous investigation of murder, greed, and betrayal. The series premieres on ZEE5 on September 26, following the trailer launch on September 8.

Allu Arjun heaps praise on Teja Sajja's Mirai, calls it technical brillianceTeja Sajja's 'Mirai' has emerged as a box-office success, earning praise from industry mains including Allu Arjun, for its passion, scale, and technical excellence. With global collections crossing Rs 100 crore and continuous fan support, the film is set to enjoy a strong theatrical run ahead.

Cinema is the heartbeat of my soul: Mohanlal after Dadasaheb Phalke winMohanlal accepted the Dadasaheb Phalke Award at the 71st National Awards with a stirring speech, calling the honour "not a dream-come-true but something sacred," and dedicating it to Malayalam cinema and its legendary fore-runners.

When Katrina Kaif reflected on childhood and her hopes as a future motherKatrina Kaif shared her thoughts on fatherhood, the absence of a father figure during her upbringing, and her hopes for her future children. The actor and her husband Vicky Kaushal are expecting their first child.

Aryan Khan nails star power in The Ba***ds of Bollywood with no wasted cameosAryan Khan's directorial debut with 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' shines with 21 Bollywood cameos, sharp storytelling, and a vision that proves he's more than just Shah Rukh Khan's son.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan recalls time when wife Jaya played host on the showOn 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', Big B shared Navratri greetings and welcomed contestant Pallavi Niphadkar. Bachchan recalled an episode where his wife Jaya hosted, and he became the contestant, describing himself as speechless.

Mastiii 4 teaser: OG trio Vivek, Riteish, Aftab promise four times laughter and funThe teaser of 'Mastiii 4' starring Vivek Oberoi, Aftab Shivdasani and Riteish Deshmukh is out. The film is slated to release in theatres on November 21.

Parineeti Chopra back on YouTube with baby bump and life updates. WatchActor Parineeti Chopra on Tuesday announced her YouTube comeback eight months after starting her channel. The latest video featured the actor exploring different ideas and genres for her channel and reacting to viral memes, while giving a baby bump update.

Nana Patekar offers support to Pak shelling victims, provides Rs 42 lakh aidActor Nana Patekar's Nirmala Gajanan Foundation, in collaboration with the Indian Army, distributed Rs 42 lakh rehabilitation aid to 117 families affected by cross-border shelling in Rajouri and Poonch in the aftermath of Operation Sindoor. Patekar called it a collective responsibility of citizens.

Kumar Sanu's ex-wife Rita alleges abuse during pregnancy: They locked kitchenKumar Sanu's ex-wife, Rita Bhattacharya, alleged that she faced abuse from the singer and his family while pregnant with their son, Jaan Kumar Sanu. She also claimed his behaviour changed after he gained fame with 'Aashiqui', and highlighted instances of mistreatment and neglect during their marriage.

Samantha and rumoured boyfriend Raj Nidimoru hit the gym together in MumbaiSamantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru were seen together at a Bandra gym in Mumbai. Their joint appearance has fuelled ongoing rumours about their relationship.

general news.headline: Quad summit on horizon after 'encouraging' India-US trade talks in New YorkIndia and US trade talks in New York show fresh momentum after tariff setbacks. Sources say discussions are constructive, with the possibility of a Quad summit before year's end.

Bombing own people: India mocks Pak at UN over Khyber Pakhtunkhwa strikesIndian diplomat Kshitij Tyagi slammed Pakistan at UNHRC, accusing it of exporting terror, illegally occupying J&K, and "bombing their own people," after deadly airstrikes killed civilians in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

I ended 7 unendable wars including India and Pak: Trump at UN General AssemblyAt the UN General Assembly session, US President Donald Trump repeated his claim that he had a hand in solving the military flare-up between India and Pakistan.

White House demands probe after Trump, Melania stuck on UN escalator rideA stalled UN escalator carrying President Trump and First Lady Melania sparked White House outrage, with Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt demanding an investigation amid suspicions staff intentionally triggered the mishap.

How India destroyed Pakistan in sign-language warIndia's dominance over mujahid mentality-infested Pakistan spans both the battlefield and cricket field. It has turned Pakistani provocations into opportunities to assert control. From Operation Sindoor to Arshdeep Singh's viral on-field gesture, India's evidence-backed strikes and measured retorts on the field have left Pakistan outplayed in every arena.

Not one call: Shashi Tharoor slams diaspora over silence on India-US setbacksCongress MP Shashi Tharoor urged Indian-Americans to push US lawmakers on India policy, noting diaspora silence on H-1B fees, tariffs, and trade issues as a Democratic delegation reaffirmed bipartisan support for ties.

Skilled Indians welcome in Germany, says envoy after US's H-1B visa shake-upIn a subtle jab at the Trump administration's abrupt overhaul of the H-1B visa system, Dr Philipp Ackermann, German Ambassador to India, highlighted Germany's stable and rewarding immigration policies.

US govt proposes new H-1B visa system, favours high-skilled, high-waged workersThe Trump administration's H-1B visa overhaul, prioritising high-skilled, well-paid workers, follows a hefty $100,000 fee hike. Aimed at curbing the visa programme's alleged misuse, the move has sparked a debate about whether it would really protect American jobs or drive talent abroad.

India predicted XI for Super 4 clash vs Bangladesh: Will Jasprit Bumrah be rested?Asia Cup, India vs Bangladesh Super 4 predicted XI: During the opening round, India experimented with their line-up only once their place in the Super Four had been secured. Now, with the business end of the tournament approaching, the management are expected to retain the same combination for the clash against Bangladesh.

Kolkata reels from record rain in 40 years, more in store as Durga Puja nearsThe wet spell that submerged Kolkata on Monday and Tuesday is expected to persist till September 25, clouding the run-up to Durga Puja.
ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.

Trump and Epstein statue appears on National Mall sparking controversyA 12-foot statue of Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein holding hands has been installed on the National Mall. The display has drawn responses from officials and continues to fuel discussion on their past association.

This silver is gold: Suhana, Aryan's sweet note for papa SRK's National Award winSuhana Khan and Aryan Khan posted a sweet message for their father Shah Rukh Khan after he received the National Film Award for Best Actor for 'Jawan'.

Karnataka CM to Azim Premji: Lend me a road, I've a traffic problem to solveKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah wrote to Wipro founder Azim Premji to allow limited vehicular movement through the campus, aiming to ease traffic on Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road.

Video: UP headmaster under probe for assault thrashes education officer with beltBrijendra Verma, the headmaster of a primary school in Sitapur district, was under enquiry for allegedly harassing an assistant teacher from the same school.

Trump says Ukraine can win back all its land, calls Russia a paper tigerUS President Donald Trump said Ukraine, with EU and NATO support, can retake all Russian-occupied territory, calling Moscow a "paper tiger" facing economic turmoil, while vowing continued US weapons supplies to NATO.

How Pawan Singh's participation in Rise & Fall was a missed opportunityBhojpuri actor Pawan Singh's exit from 'Rise & Fall' was announced by the show's host Ashneer Grover on Sunday. Despite being called 'TRP king' by his fans, his stint on the reality show was far from impressive. Here's why.

Bulldozer verdict gave immense satisfaction: Chief Justice BR GavaiThe ruling, delivered last year by a bench of Justices BR Gavai and KV Viswanathan, condemned the practice of arbitrary demolitions as it delivered a verdict on petitions challenging bulldozer action.

He is putting one hell of a fight: Trump praises Zelenskyy during New York meetThis marked the fourth meeting between the two leaders since Trump returned to office in January. Their discussions come as tensions rise between Nato and Moscow following a string of Russian aerial incursions into allied airspace.

SRK's struggle to wear National Award medal goes viral. Rani-Vikrant come to rescueShah Rukh Khan struggled to wear his medal at the 71st National Film Awards 2025. The cute moment was captured on video and quickly went viral among fans online.

Trump can win Nobel only if...: Macron on US President's ambitions after UN addressEmmanuel Macron said that Donald Trump could only win the Nobel Peace Prize if he ends the Gaza conflict, stressing that only Washington has the leverage to pressure Israel. Macron also warned France is prepared for possible Israeli retaliation over its recognition of a Palestinian state.

Hope we can fix it: Rubio on US tariffs over India's Russian oil purchasesUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the Trump administration hopes to "fix" punitive tariffs on India over Russian oil, even as Washington considers tougher sanctions against Moscow and urges Europe to act.

Husband fails to consummate marriage, wife seeks Rs 2 crore compensationA marital dispute escalated in Bengaluru after a wife allegedly demanded Rs 2 crore over unconsummated relations, with the husband claiming assault by her family and filing a police complaint.

sports.headline: Pakistan not at the same level as India, feel bad for them sometimes: Ishant SharmaIndia's dominance over Pakistan in the Asia Cup has reignited debates around the once-iconic rivalry. Ishant Sharma's remarks highlight how Pakistan's players buckle under fan pressure, unlike their past stars, raising questions about the current team's competitiveness.

Hussain Talat eyes title after PAK beat SL: Two matches, trophy is oursPakistan all-rounder Hussain Talat hailed his team's five-wicket win over Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup Super Four, emphasising that players are regaining form and aiming for the title.

Pakistan bounce back to hammer Sri Lanka, stay alive in final raceAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan overcame Sri Lanka in a tense and nervy chase to secure valuable points in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup. After a disciplined bowling show, Pakistan chased down a 133-run target in just 18 overs in Dubai on Tuesday, September 23.

ICC suspends USA cricket body over governance issuesThe International Cricket Council has suspended USA Cricket membership citing governance failures and reputational damage. The ICC will oversee US teams and guide reforms to protect cricket's future in the country.

After war of celebrations, Hasaranga hugs it out with Pakistan's Abrar AhmedWanindu Hasaranga and Abrar Ahmed lit up the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash on Tuesday with a playful duel of wickets and imitations, turning a tense low-scoring game into box-office theatre.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
